intro: Agenora laevigata, commonly known as the smooth agenora, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its smooth, dark green leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Agenora laevigata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to warm climates.
